page.title: 02RIVER CALDER, CALDER VALE
page.content:
The{River Calder}rises on Calder Fell to the north of the block and flows through a steep sided and sometimes very narrow valley in a SW direction.
In times past the water has been used to provide power for the machinery at the various local mills, including the two weaving mills at Calder Vale.
At the bottom of Church Wood there can still be seen a large "lodge" or reservoir where the water is diverted for this purpose. This lodge now adds to the attractiveness of the woods.
In the centre of the village the small but steep river valley is spanned by a stone bridge.
To the SW, the river flows through Sullom Wood to join the River Wyre.
